channel.title: Artsy Engineering Radio
channel.description: A podcast exploring questions in software engineering.
channel.itunes:subtitle: A podcast exploring questions in software engineering.
channel.itunes:summary: A podcast exploring questions in software engineering.
channel.itunes:keywords: engineering, software engineering, software development, open source
channel.itunes:author: Artsy Engineering

item.title: 0: Introducing Artsy Engineering Radio
item.description: Jon Allured, Matt Dole, and Steve Hicks introduce you to Artsy Engineering Radio and help you understand why you need another podcast in your life.
item.itunes:author: Jon Allured, Matt Dole, & Steve Hicks
item.itunes:summary: Jon Allured, Matt Dole, and Steve Hicks introduce you to Artsy Engineering Radio and help you understand why you need another podcast in your life.
item.itunes:keywords: engineering, software engineering, software development, open source

item.title: 1: How To Have Good Meetings
item.description: Ash Furrow talks with Steve Hicks about facilitating meaningful and inclusive team meetings, and how meetings are part of building teams, trust, and systems.
item.itunes:author: Ash Furrow & Steve Hicks
item.itunes:summary: Ash Furrow talks with Steve Hicks about facilitating meaningful and inclusive team meetings, and how meetings are part of building teams, trust, and systems.
item.itunes:keywords: engineering, software engineering, software development, open source

item.title: 2: How Artsy Hires Engineers
item.description: Ash Furrow and Steve Hicks talk about hiring practices to avoid, how Artsy hires engineers, and the right questions to ask in an interview.
item.itunes:author: Ash Furrow & Steve Hicks
item.itunes:summary: Ash Furrow and Steve Hicks talk about hiring practices to avoid, how Artsy hires engineers, and the right questions to ask in an interview.
item.itunes:keywords: engineering, software engineering, software development, open source
item.content:encoded:
Links:
  • How Artsy Hires Engineers by Ash Furrow, Lily Pace, & Steve Hicks
  • Learning from Artsy: How to hire awesome engineers by Brennan Moore
  • Interviewing, applying and getting your first job in iOS by Orta Therox
  • Artsy jobs

item.title: 3: WAYAHDYGH: Chris
item.description: Matt Dole asks engineer Chris Pappas who he is and how he got here. Tune in to learn about BBSes and how skateboarding started Chris's career in software.
item.itunes:author: Matt Dole & Christopher Pappas
item.itunes:summary: Matt Dole asks engineer Chris Pappas who he is and how he got here. Tune in to learn about BBSes and how skateboarding started Chris's career in software.
item.itunes:keywords: engineering, software engineering, software development, open source

item.title: 4: Scaling Your Impact
item.description: Jon Allured, Ash Furrow, and Steve Hicks discuss scaling your impact as an engineer. How can engineers be more effective and create more value than we capture?
item.itunes:author: Jon Allured, Ash Furrow, & Steve Hicks
item.itunes:summary: Jon Allured, Ash Furrow, and Steve Hicks discuss scaling your impact as an engineer. How can engineers be more effective and create more value than we capture?
item.itunes:keywords: engineering, software engineering, software development, open source

item.title: 5: The Structure of Artsy's Product Team
item.description: Jon Allured and Joanna Brocksen discuss the structure of Arty's Product team. What even is a PDDE??
item.itunes:author: Jon Allured & Joanna Brocksen
item.itunes:summary: Jon Allured and Joanna Brocksen discuss the structure of Arty's Product team. What even is a PDDE??
item.itunes:keywords: engineering, software engineering, software development, open source
item.content:encoded:
Links:
  • Knowledge Shares For Great Good
  • Artsy Jobs Page
  • Artsy on Twitter
  • Jon Allured on Twitter

item.title: 6: Software Engineering And Creative Practice
item.description: Eve Essex talks to Steve Hicks about the differences between building infrastructure and building products, the intersection of software engineering and creative practice, and why you can't afford to be precious about the product.
item.itunes:author: Eve Essex & Steve Hicks
item.itunes:summary: Eve Essex talks to Steve Hicks about the differences between building infrastructure and building products, the intersection of software engineering and creative practice, and why you can't afford to be precious about the product.
item.itunes:keywords: engineering, software engineering, software development, open source
item.content:encoded:
Links:
  • Eve Essex on SoundCloud
  • Eve Essex on Bandcamp
  • Eve Essex on Spotify
  • Eve Essex on Apple Music

item.title: 7: WAYAHDYGH: Anna
item.description: Anna Carey joins us to talk about overcoming impostor syndrome, asking for help, and her path from Artsy to coding bootcamp and back to Artsy.
item.itunes:author: Anna Carey & Matt Dole
item.itunes:summary: Anna Carey joins us to talk about overcoming impostor syndrome, asking for help, and her path from Artsy to coding bootcamp and back to Artsy.
item.itunes:keywords: engineering, software engineering, software development, open source

item.title: 8: Scaling Your Impact pt 2, this time with Orta
item.description: Orta Therox tells Jon Allured and Steve Hicks how he became a top contributor to open source software, and teaches them how to get better at things like design and pair programming.
item.itunes:author: Orta Therox, Jon Allured, & Steve Hicks
item.itunes:summary: Orta Therox tells Jon Allured and Steve Hicks how he became a top contributor to open source software, and teaches them how to get better at things like design and pair programming.
item.itunes:keywords: engineering, software engineering, software development, open source
item.content:encoded:
Links:
  • Orta on GitHub
  • Orta on Twitter

item.title: 9: WAYAHDYGH: Sam
item.description: Artsy's Executive Vice President of Product and Engineering Sam Rozenberg joins us to talk about his transition from finance to tech, moving from Spotify to Instagram to Artsy, and what he thinks is most special about Artsy’s engineering culture.
item.itunes:author: Anna Carey & Sam Rozenberg
item.itunes:summary: Artsy's Executive Vice President of Product and Engineering Sam Rozenberg joins us to talk about his transition from finance to tech, moving from Spotify to Instagram to Artsy, and what he thinks is most special about Artsy’s engineering culture.
item.itunes:keywords: engineering, software engineering, software development, open source

item.title: 10: Jon's Habits
item.description: Jon & Steve hang out and talk about stuff. Steve gives Jon (probably) bad advice about building a content strategy, and Jon talks about the habits in his personal operating system.
item.itunes:author: Jon Allured & Steve Hicks
item.itunes:summary: Jon & Steve hang out and talk about stuff. Steve gives Jon (probably) bad advice about building a content strategy, and Jon talks about the habits in his personal operating system.
item.itunes:keywords: engineering, software engineering, software development, open source
item.content:encoded:
Links:
  • 'The blog series' that Steve forgets to describe, which is on maximizing productivity during small blocks of time
  • Jon's blog
  • Monica Lent's 'Blogging For Devs' community
  • Forty, Jon's app for tracking time

item.title: 11: WAYAHDYGH: Joey
item.description: Matt Dole and Director of Platform Engineering Joey Aghion discuss Joey's life as an engineer. What has he learned from working at multiple failed startups? What is he excited about building at Artsy?
item.itunes:author: Matt Dole & Joey Aghion
item.itunes:summary: Matt Dole and Director of Platform Engineering Joey Aghion discuss Joey's life as an engineer. What has he learned from working at multiple failed startups? What is he excited about building at Artsy?
item.itunes:keywords: engineering, software engineering, software development, open source

item.title: 12: Request for Comment #1
item.description: Join Anna Carey, Jon Allured, Justin Bennett, and Matt Dole as they discuss how Artsy's engineering culture has changed as the team has grown, making the software industry more inclusive, and what it means to be a 'good engineer'
item.itunes:author: Jon Allured, Justin Bennett, Anna Carey, Matt Dole
item.itunes:summary: Join Anna Carey, Jon Allured, Justin Bennett, and Matt Dole as they discuss how Artsy's engineering culture has changed as the team has grown, making the software industry more inclusive, and what it means to be a 'good engineer'
item.itunes:keywords: engineering, software engineering, software development, open source

item.title: 13: Effective Tech Leadership...question mark?
item.description: Anson Wang shares his experiences as a tech lead with Steve Hicks. They talk about navigating feedback, leading projects, and being a supportive leader. Anson leaves you with a fun fact you can't unsee.
item.itunes:author: Anson Wang & Steve Hicks
item.itunes:summary: Anson Wang shares his experiences as a tech lead with Steve Hicks. They talk about navigating feedback, leading projects, and being a supportive leader. Anson leaves you with a fun fact you can't unsee.
item.itunes:keywords: engineering, software engineering, software development, open source
